name: A Bed of Mushrooms
description: Starfleet has come up with a plan to stop the spread of the tribbles without harming them via the mycelial network. But Larkin may have prepared for any attempts to thwart his beloved creations. Can you see the tribbles removed once and for all?
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Chekov, Phlox, Quark, Exobiologists, Tribbled crew, Tribble Kirk, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Glenn, NCC-1701 Enterprise, or the K'Tinga Battlecruiser will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Chekov, Phlox, Quark, or Kirk

featured_crew.name: Phlox
featured_crew.flavor: Phlox brings a small number of tribbles aboard Enterprise NX-01 as an easily sustainable food source for his pets.

featured_crew.name: Quark
featured_crew.flavor: Quark must deal with an infestation of Tribbles in his bar.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Klingon K't'inga Battlecruiser
ship.flavor: A follow up to the powerful D7 Battlecruiser, the K't'inga Class was the primary warship of the Klingon Empire in the late 23rd century.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "The crew of the Glenn--where I've been serving--have had a breakthrough. We're going to transport the tribbles into the mycelial network. I don't know much about spore drives, but mass transport... I can do that."

"Excellent, Mister Chekov. Captain, we'll need you to cover the Glenn. Larkin must have had allies, in this timeline or others. We've got hostile vessels targeting the Glenn, trying to stop our plans."
"The strange thing is that we aren't detecting any sentient life signs aboard the ships. I'll keep trying to figure out what might be wrong with our scanners...."

"The crew of the Glenn--where I've been serving--have had a breakthrough. We're going to transport the tribbles into the mycelial network. I don't know much about spore drives, but mass transport... I can do that."

"Excellent, Mister Chekov. Captain, we'll need you to cover the Glenn. Larkin must have had allies, in this timeline or others. We've got hostile vessels targeting the Glenn, trying to stop our plans."
"The strange thing is that we aren't detecting any sentient life signs aboard the ships. I'll keep trying to figure out what might be wrong with our scanners...."
"We've had a rather... surprising development. Although, frankly, after traveling decades through time to find myself here, still buried in tribbles, I'm not sure how anything surprises me anymore."

responses.text: "This is no time for jokes, Doctor Bashir!"
"Edward Larkin is a deeply disturbed man."

screens.text: "The hostile vessels are being manned... well, I suppose, guided... by tribbles."
"I'm afraid it's no joke, Captain. I detect no less than double each ship's complement in fuzz."
"If only he could be cured, imagine what he could accomplish with a mind like that...."
"The ships are heavily modified, almost automated. Tribbles can only do so much... but perhaps it was the symbolism that was important to Larkin here."
"Chekov tells me the Glenn is very close to being ready to mass transport the tribbles into the mycelial network. We just need a little more time."
"We've had a rather... surprising development. Although, frankly, after traveling decades through time to find myself here, still buried in tribbles, I'm not sure how anything surprises me anymore."

responses.text: "This is no time for jokes, Doctor Bashir!"
"Edward Larkin is a deeply disturbed man."

screens.text: "The hostile vessels are being manned... well, I suppose, guided... by tribbles."
"I'm afraid it's no joke, Captain. I detect no less than double each ship's complement in fuzz."
"If only he could be cured, imagine what he could accomplish with a mind like that...."
"The ships are heavily modified, almost automated. Tribbles can only do so much... but perhaps it was the symbolism that was important to Larkin here."
"Chekov tells me the Glenn is very close to being ready to mass transport the tribbles into the mycelial network. We just need a little more time."
